value: Heidelberg Castle from the Bridge over the Necker

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Depicted is a large castle complex on a hill surrounded by trees.  The central building is multistoried with a steeply pitched roof and turret visible.  Behind this is a lower windowed building that terminates in a larger, octagonal four-story tower.  Lower buildings are joined in front of the central building, with a fortified, semicircular structure overlooking the bluff.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet illustrating two sketches of architectural details.  At left, a section of a masonry building façade that is heavily decorated with scrolling ornament.  There are two windows with triangular pediments, and the top of the façade projects upward to a pedestal upon which stands the sculpture of a figure.  At right is a very simple tower surmounted by an onion dome with a smooth surface only interrupted by a small chimney stack.  Without interruption, the top of the dome becomes an octagonal steeple with tall finial and decorative banner or weathervane at its top.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with frayed bottom and right edge.  Illustrated are sketches of buildings and architectural features.  Beginning from top left are two domed steeples, both with shingled onion-shaped cupolas and tall finials. At right is an elevation of a timbered building with a large, deep gable on both stories which shade open windows with shutters.  In the center is a very small sketch of a dormer within a shingled or tiled roof.  At lower left is likely the same gabled building sketched on the  upper half of the sheet, but now viewed from a corner angle, the gables supported by very large timbers which the artist identifies as being "at least 3 ft."  At lower right is a very quickly sketched tiled or shingled roof with an awkwardly oversize "bell" cupola, as it is named by the artist.  The cupola projects from the roof on a very thin support, and balloons above it.  The cupola is shingled, and terminates in a small ball finial with weathervane.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, on cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with two sketches of buildings.  At left is a half-timbered building with a shingled or tiled steeply pitched roof that has a very deep overhang.  The building is raised up on tall timber supports that create a framed archway beneath the first story, which has a white façade and two windows with green shutters.  The sketch at right is possibly the same building seen at lower right in 1943-51-127.  It is a long building also with a steeply pitched shingled or tiled roof that is canted at the end.  A clock face is visible in a triangular roof dormer.  Above this is a bell-shaped cupola surmounting a very thin structure.  The cupola has a tall finial with ball and weathervane ornament.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor over graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with small drawing in upper left corner depicting a half-timber structure seen from one side.  The roof is steeply pitched and there are two deep eaves visible.  There is a balcony below a window that is supported from below by large timbers.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Grand Central Terminal, New York, NY: Design for Façade

label: Description
value: South facade of lower and upper story, with stairway leading up to the main entrance at center.  Five bays, alternately of different sizes, are placed between the corner projections. Roof ornamentation suggested at upper center of upper story.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, graphite on cream tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. William Greenough; 1943: acquired by Museum

label: Notes
value: South facade of lower and upper story, with stairway leading up to the main entrance at center. Five bays, alternately of different sizes, are placed between the corner projections. Roof ornamentation suggested at upper center of upper story.

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with sketches of timber structures and architectural details.  At top left is a round-arched leaded glass window composed of round glass lenses and promient metal bars dividing the window vertically and horizontally.  At right is the façade of a timber and plaster building with its upper stories fully rendered.  The building has a tiled roof, deep eaves, and a projecting canopy.  At center left are two sketches: the shuttered window of a water shed, and the detail of cross-beam paneling below.  Below these is another quickly sketched half-timbered building (possibly the same as that shown above right).  At bottom right is a stable seen from the side.  Its has a pair of double doors with an open timbered slats above.  Its right side is timber and plaster with a stone course below.  It has a single door opening with a small square window to its proper right.  Above this is another square window with prominent strap hinges also at proper right.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with six sketches of architectural details.  At the top are two different styles of chimneys with the artist's notes about colors and material.  Below this at left is the detail of the underside of an eave with the artist's notes again about material and and position of the elements, specifically "to let / floor beams protrude / as far as possible / under overhang and / to fill up betweenwith plaster / it gives / softness". To the right of this is a lightly sketched timber structure with a prominent dormer and roof with deep eaves visibly supported by beams from underneath.  Below this drawing is another half-timber and plaster stucture identified as a "farm house".  At bottom right is a large half-timbered building with masonry lower story and a low, swooping wooden eave supported by y-shaped timbers at the front.  A smaller timber structure with steeply pitched roof is attached to the rear.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet containing three sketches of buildings.  At top left is the upper section of a half-timbered structure. At top right is a timber building with a tall tiled roof with a small dormer at the corner.  At center is a half-timber building with smaller shed at the front, and a water source flows from under the building's right corner.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Three Views of Gargoyles, Baden Baden

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting two gargoyles: one is depicted from both the front and side, while the other below is only shown from the side. Each is mounted at a ninety-degree angle to an elaborate scrolling metal bracket.  The bracket and gargoyles have been tinted green, as if to imply a painted or patinated copper surface.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with one sketch of a Romanesque gate.  The masonry gate has a small archway at its base, two stair turrets at either corner with crenellation at their tops, a high peaked roof in the center, and a clock on its façade.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet containing two sketches of belfries.  The belfry at left is a small Gothic tower which projects from a tiled roof.  The tower has a stonework lancet on all sides and small bell visible in the center.  Its roof rises to a very narrow steeple and is adorned on all sides by very finely worked crockets.  The other belfry at right is also Gothic in style but much more simple, rising from a short octagonal tower and encircled by a gallery.  It has a paneled roof that rises to a narrow steeple with small ball finial at top.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with five sketches of architectural details.  Depicted in the upper half of the sheet are two belfries, each with a gilt ball finial, as noted by the artist.  Below this at left is a chimney top with two rows of openings topped by a small pitched, tile roof.  At bottom left is a doorway framed by quoins.  At right is balcony with balustrade viewed from below.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Ironwork, Door to City Hall, Basle (Basel)

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting a doorway with an iron gate framed by ashlar masonry with an open transom above filled with elaborately interlocking and scrolling ironwork.  The ironwork of both the transom and the gate are magnified in detail in two sketches below.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with numerous sketches of architectural elements.  Clockwise from bottom left: a dormer with ogee-shaped roof, gutter, and small gargoyle spout at the corner.  This same spout is drawn to the left.  Above this is a horizontal fountain spout in the shape of a man blowing into a pipe.  In the top half of the sheet are three sketches: below left is a window made of five round-arched lancets that graduate in size. The window is flanked by louvered shutters.  Above is the arched top of a doorway filled with greyish black scrolling ironwork.  At right is a dormer with a tiled roof that cantilevers far over the window opening below it.  The cantilever is supported by ogee brackets on either side of the window.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Railing and Wall Decoration of Hospital, St. Ambrose, Milan

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with three sketches. At top right is a section of wall decoration from Sant'Ambrogio, Milan.  One quadrant of a sunburst is depicted with green, pink, and yellow wavy rays emanating from the center.  To the left of this is  graphite version of the entire motif, like a pinwheel with alternating shaded arms.  Below this is a railing section with vertical members filled with squares of scrolling ironwork.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Old Castle of the Gonzagas, Mantova

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting a very finely carved modillion viewed from the front and in profile.  It is a delicate bluish-gray, possibly indicating it was marble.  The front view shows the modillion with a large leaf that terminates in a scrolle.  The side view reveals the modillion curved profile begins and ends with a rosette.  The main decorative element is a long, scrolling vine with lacy leaves and a small winged creature perched on the vine.  This section has a large, oblong beaded molding.  The right side of the modillion has another decorative element in its own panel, that of a slender, tall vase with leaf ornament at the base.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with four sketches of architectural elements.  At top left is a faucet in the shape of a winged bird.  At right is the section of a door from the church of St. Anastasia.  The door is composed of rows of small tri-lobed arches, possibly painted white, and decorated by nailheads.  Below this at right is another wood door from St. Anastasia also with a creamy-white finish.  This door is ornamented by rows of carved quatrefoils with a border of half-rosettes and a diamond pattern.  Dark gray nailheads stand out in contrast.  At lower left is a section of an iron railing consisting of joined quatrefoils.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Pilaster, Certosa di Pavia, and Hanging Lamp, Sant'Anastasia, Verona

label: Description
value: Vertical sheets with two drawings.  In the center is an elaborately pierced iron lamp, like a basket, suspended from two chains made of s-shaped links that hang from a delicate leafy bracket.  Above is a pilaster drawn so that its orientation on the page is horizontal.  It is rendered in graphite without any wash, perhaps to indicate the material was marble.  The pilaster has a panel of vase-like and leafy ornament, with an elaborate capital above.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Detail and Section View of Wood Ceiling, Sacristy at St. Zeno, Verona

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet showing cross section of a wooden ceiling created by a curved upper section of wall that meets flat paneling and coffers. The drawing above is a detail of the coffered ceiling, painted in shades of yellow, blue, and salmon.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting statue of a man seated on horseback raised on a plinth mounted on a thick cornice.  The cornice is supported by Corinthian columns set on high bases.  This is all raised up on a three-part stepped rectangular base.  All elements of this monument have a greenish-gray color, as if to indicate they are made of a gray metal, or a patinated copper.  The sheet has pin holes in all four corners.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with an uneven or torn bottom edge and pinholes at all four corners.  Three lamps on pedestals at gondola landings are depicted, all in shades of green with small elements highlighted in yellow to indicate gilding.  From left, a lamp in front of the Hotel de l'Europe; in the middle, a lamp from Piazza San Marco; and at right, a lamp from the landing near the Bridge of Straw (Ponte delle Paglia).

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Plan and Elevation, Pulpit at Torcello

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet depicting a colonnaded structure with a small recessed opening visible. A carved panel and elaborately carved moldings have been sketched in the center section.  Various details have also been given letter designations which correspond to their color, which is sometimes noted in the margin to the left of this drawing.  Below is a view in plan of a circular structure with columnar supports visible.  There is another small drawing of a molding detail at center right.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  The main and best rendered of the three sketches on the sheet is the dome of San Marco, Venice, at left.  The artist has depicted the arcaded cupola and finial in great detail.  To the right are two sketches of chimneys.  Each has a narrow shaft with a trapezoidal cap.  The cap is inverted so that the widest part is at the top of the chimney stack.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on cream paperboard adhered to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
Lion and Pedestal, Palazzo Vecchio, Florence

label: Description
value: Horizontal sheet cut down from a larger size, with pinholes at the top corners.  Depicted is the statue of a lion seated on a large pedestal seen from the side. The pedestal consists of a thick cornice supported by two inverted pillars (like balusters) at either corner.  In the center is a panel with a fleur-de-lys in a wreath and festoons of ribbons coming out from all four corners of the wreath. Other sketches on the sheet depict various details of the ornament on the pedestal, with inscriptions identifying them (clockwise from top left): cornice, architrave moulding, shield, column, pillars, fleur de lys, part of wreath, shields and festoon.  These are all tinted cream to pale beige, as if to imply marble.  The lion is a soft gray-green, implying either a patinated metal or stone surface.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Iron Lamps and Torch Bearers, Palazzo Strozzi, Florence

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with four sketches of lighting implements.  At the top left and right are two torch bearers. The one at left in the form of griffin with the head of a classical goddess which holds in her mouth a short flange that ends in a large round bobeche.   The one at right is a similar form, but instead is a  horned dragon with its spiny wing extended, and it holds a different bobeche in its mouth.  Below center is a large iron lamp in the form of a small building.  Three columns support an entablature from which three very large curved spikes rise from the corners.  The two sides that are visible have a double lancet opening and panels below.  To the right of this drawing is the bracket that supports the lamp, decorated with a lion, banner, modillions, and rosettes.  The drawings are all tinted a pinkish-gray.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet tipped horizontally into binding depicting a modillion from the front and side.  The front view has a molding of small oak leaves at the top, with the long, swooping lines of a large leaf below.  The side view of the modillion is read perpendicular to the front view.  It shows the modillion has a scroll terminating in a rosette at either end.  The field above the scroll is tinted yellow and has short, intersecting lines, as if to imply a crackled surface.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
Iron Gate and Balcony, Il Bargello, Florence

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet tipped horizontally into binding, divided into two halves.  The upper half of the sheet depicts an ironwork gate, while the lower half depicts a section of a balcony.  A corner of the gate is illustrated, showing a horizontal and vertical member intersected and an iron mesh in the center.  The links of iron have been cross-hatched, giving the impression that the metal was braided.  The top of the gate has three groups of three spiky projections.  The metal of the gate is rendered in slate blue. The drawing below shows what could be a section of the architrave of a balcony.  The lower portion has a frieze of shells inscribed in circles.  The field around the shells is bright yellow with crazed lines, mimicking a crackled surface.  Above this is another frieze separted by a beaded course.  The frieze alternates larger shells (almost like anthemion) with the heads of cherubs.  The heads are encircled by halo-like spheres.  The spheres alternate sections of three gold dots and a strip of color, as shown here, either green or blue.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet with pinhole at bottom left and right corner missing. Depicted is the elevation of an architrave supported by a pilaster and paneling on a raised plinth. This is drawn so that the architrave and top of the pilaster are at the top and left side of the sheet, while the bottom half of the pilaster, the paneling, and plinth are drawn to the right.  The details of the architrave moldings have only been rendered at the left corner, but the architrave frieze of winged cherubs alternating with torches has been completed across the sheet. The frieze has a royal blue ground while the torches are bright yellow.  The frieze ends in a crowned yellow star.  The Corinthian pilaster is decorated with a festoon of greenery suspended from a yellow ring at the top of the shaft.  This ornamental festoon continues on the bottom half of the pilaster.  Only the left side of the plinth and the paneling are drawn.  The paneling appears to alternate a light marble or stone pilaster with a decorated motif - a shield or coat of arms as is illustrated here in green, yellow, and blue.  The use of color indicates the actual medium of the pilaster and architrave might be majolica or faience typical of Italian Renaissance-period decoration.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
Elevation and Details of Masonry, Glass Window

label: Description
value: Vertical sheet illustrating various scaled masonry elements, a stained glass window, and another unidentified decorative architectural component.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
